abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental assessment for the
            Second Tianjin Urban Development and Environment Project
            describes how negative environmental impacts will be
            mitigated. Some of them are included here: The maintenance
            of machinery and vehicles will be enhanced to ensure that no
            discharge of black smoke and to strictly comply with the
            city's regulation for motored vehicles. Secondary dust
            raised by construction and transport vehicles will be
            managed by controlling the speed and weight of the vehicles.
            Other dust control measures include water spraying, cleaning
            truck wheels at all entrances and exits, and sweeping
            construction sites. To reduce air pollution, exhaust
            pollutants will be limited and monitored according to
            present regulations. Noise levels near schools, hospitals,
            and residential buildings caused by construction machinery
            and transport vehicles, are short term and temporary and
            will be measured; and if not controlled, especially at
            night, will disturb residents. Noise abatement will include
            reinforcing windows. Temporary bypass measures and
            rearranging public transportation bus lines may ease traffic
            congestion. Discarded soil will be disposed of, cleaned in
            time, and transported to fixed sites. Replanting vegetation
            will reduce soil erosion, lessen traffic dust and noise,
            adjust and improve the road climate, and improve road landscaping.
